name: v1.2.1
body:
## Notes
* This release should be compatible with Bazel 6.0.0 when it comes out.

## What's Changed
* Add the `mathastext` package by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/101
* Run Buildifier on CI by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/99
* Add `beamertheme-metropolis` and its dependencies by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/103
* Pin Bazel version to 5.3.2 by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/104
* Use the external `@platforms` repo by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/105


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/compare/v1.2.0...v1.2.1

name: v1.2.0
body:
## What's Changed
* Upgrade to TeXLive 2022.03.21 by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/89


**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/compare/v1.1.2...v1.2.0

name: v1.1.2
body:
## Important notes
* This release will be the last on TeXLive 2019. The next one will use TeXLive 2022.

## Change summaries
 * `lm`, `marginfix`, `changepage`, `titling`, `contour`, `ragged2e`, `mdframed`, `pgfplots`, `babel_dutch`, `hyph_utf8`, `koma_script`, `translations` and `cooking-units` have been added
 * Support for DVI output has been added
 * Errors should have more information

## What's Changed
* Add lm by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/69
* Add marginfix by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/81
* Add changepage by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/80
* Add titling by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/79
* Add contour by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/78
* Add ragged2e by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/77
* Add mdframed and its dependencies by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/76
* Add pgfplots by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/75
* Add babel_dutch, hyph_utf8 and koma_script by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/73
* Add the translations package by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/74
* Fix spelling mistakes by @Vertexwahn in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/83
* Refactor run_latex.py by @solsjo in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/84
* Make _view and _view_output format-agnostic by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/88
* Display the tool's stderr/stdout on build failure by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/90
* Use GitHub Actions for CI by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/91
* Disable Windows on CI by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/95
* Disable Ubuntu on GitHub Actions by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/96
* Ignore IntelliJ's .ijwb by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/92
* Fix long filenames by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/98
* Add the `cooking-units` package by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/97
* Update the Docker image used by Cirrus CI by @Kernald in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/100

## New Contributors
* @Vertexwahn made their first contribution in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/83
* @solsjo made their first contribution in https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/pull/84

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/bazel-latex/compare/v1.1.1...v1.1.2

name: v1.1.1
body: * Add `mflogo`, `minifp`, `lettrine`, `tabulary`, `units`, `pgfopts`, and `algorithm2e` (including deps) packages.

name: v1.1
body:
Minor but important bug fixes and other improvements, including:
* Updated CI to also build package tests.
* Added `unicode-math`, `xtemplate`, and `xfrac` package.

name: v1.0
body:
Version 1.0 of bazel-latex has arrived! Bug fixes and improvements in this release include:
* Support for BibLaTex: both `biber` and `bibtex` are supported.
* Addition of `csquotes` and `xspace` packages.
* Various bug fixes which make bazel-latex build with the latest version of bazel.

name: v0.19
body:
* Fixed issue with latexrun not being executable
* Added redirection of `xdg-open` output to `/dev/null` instead of straight to the terminal
* Added `tikz-qtree` and `gnuplottex` packages
* multicol package now uses local :tools target

name: v0.18
body:
* Implemented usage of depset constructor to merge depsets.
* Added multicol, drawstack and exam package.

name: v0.17
body:
- Upgrade to TeXLive 2019.
- Add many new packages: `currfile`, `datatool`, `filehook`, `filemod`, `fp`, `gensymb`, `gincltex`, `glossaries`, `ieeetran`, `import`, `mfirstuc`, `standalone`, `subcaption`, `substr`, `svn-prov`, `textcase`, and `xfor`.

name: v0.16
body:
- Support multiple tests per package.
- Add missing tikz dependency to moderncv.
- Omit `BUILD.bazel` and `WORKSPACE` files in input root to reduce build environment size.
- Don't use hardlinks in `run_lualatex.py`.

name: v0.15
body:
- Make TrueType and OpenType font loading work in combination with externals.
- Upgrade bazel-toolchains.

name: v0.14
body:
- Add necessary toolchain fixes to support upcoming versions of Bazel.
- Add `datenumber`, `fontawesome`, `fontspec`, `fullpage`, `hyphenat`, `ifluatex`, `kvoptions`, `luacode`, `moderncv`, `placeat`, `tcolorbox`, `tgheros`, `verbatim` and `xcharter` packages.

name: v0.13
body:
- Switch to LuaLaTeX.
- Add FreeBSD/amd64 support.
- Add the `upquote` package (by @regisd).

name: v0.12
body:
- Add a package for `silence`.
- Fix a regression in `cleveref` where `subsubsubappendix` references don't work.
- Add color output to `latexrun` to improve readability of output.
- Patch up `latexrun` to hide warnings related to bad references when a document contains errors to prevent walls of warnings.

name: v0.11
body:
- Add `//packages:datetime2_english` to load in English localisation for `datetime2`.
- Fix warnings generated by `latexrun` in `packages/*_test.tex`.
- Replace the local patch for `latexrun` with upstream pull requests https://github.com/aclements/latexrun/pull/21, https://github.com/aclements/latexrun/pull/47 and https://github.com/aclements/latexrun/pull/61. This fixes some spurious warnings in `siunitx`.

name: v0.10
body:
- Significantly simplify the way `bazel run :*_view` is implemented.
- Add a mnemonic for `latex_document()` during build, so that it no longer shows SkylarkAction, but PdfLatex.
- Use [latexrun](https://github.com/aclements/latexrun) to build documents, so that output of the build process is human friendly.

name: v0.9
body:
- Alter the README to suggest release tarballs over HTTP are used.
- Extend the documentation to mention which platforms are supported.
- Add a script for computing the minimal set of dependencies of a LaTeX document. This may be used to add new packages more easily.
- Reimplement the `*_view` target in pure Skylark, so that it no longer uses `genrule()`. This makes remote builds from Windows systems more robust.
- Add `adjustbox`, `amsthm`, `beamerthemedefault`, `beamerthemesplit`, `collectbox, `enumerate`, `makecell`, `pgfcore` and `translator` packages.

name: v0.8
body:
- Add proper license terms.
- Depend on the `bazel-bin` directory instead of `bazel-genfiles`, as the latter is deprecated.

name: v0.7
body:
- Support environments where `python` corresponds to Python 3.
- Add proper toolchain definitions, so that we can download the right LaTeX binaries based on the host system's OS and architecture.
- Add toolchain types for Linux and Darwin x86-64.

name: v0.6
body:
- Depend on [modular TeXLive](https://github.com/ProdriveTechnologies/texlive-modular) instead of using the copy from the host system.
- Reinstate the `main` argument for `latex_document()` We need it again now the number of source files for a build has increased dramatically.
- Rewrite `run_pdflatex` in Python.

name: v0.5
body: - Make the number of `pdflatex` runs variadic, running it until we get reproducible output.

name: v0.4
body: - Allow generated files to be used as part of builds by stripping the `genfiles` path prefix.

name: v0.3
body:
- Remove the default argument from `srcs`. It must be provided now.
- Run the document viewer in the background.

name: v0.2
body:
- Remove `latex_library()` target. It is fine to use `filegroup()`.
- Rename `latex_pdf()` to `latex_document()`, as it may eventually contain other targets as well.
- Make viewing of PDFs easier by running `bazel run :<target>_view`.

name: v0.1
body: First release.
